metadata.Title: CVE-2018-3838 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An exploitable information vulnerability exists in the XCF image rendering functionality of Simple DirectMedia Layer SDL2_image-2.0.2. A specially crafted XCF image can cause an out-of-bounds read on the heap, resulting in information disclosure. An attacker can display a specially crafted image to trigger this vulnerability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-3838` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsdl2-image-2.0-0 - 2.0.0+dfsg-3+deb8u1build0.14.04.1
No subscription required

libsdl-image1.2 - 1.2.12-5+deb9u1build0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libsdl2-image package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.0+dfsg-3+deb8u1build0.14.04.1').
sdl-image1.2 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.12-5+deb9u1build0.14.04.1').
